perturbation.original_text: Section 2.02. Recordation. The relevant assignee Party shall have the sole responsibility, at its sole cost and expense, to file the Intellectual Property Assignment Agreements and any other forms or documents with the appropriate Governmental Authorities as required to record the transfer of any registrations or applications of Nuance IP or SpinCo IP that is allocated under the Separation Agreement, as applicable, and the relevant assignor Party hereby consents to such recordation.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 2.02. Recordation. The relevant assignee Party shall have the sole responsibility, at its sole cost and expense, to file the Intellectual Property Assignment Agreements and any other forms or documents with the appropriate Governmental Authorities as required to record the transfer of any registrations or applications of Nuance IP or SpinCo IP that is allocated under the Separation Agreement, as applicable, but such filing must be completed within 30 days of the Distribution Date. The relevant assignor Party has no obligation to consent to such recordation, and may withhold consent at its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces a legal contradiction because it imposes a strict 30-day deadline for filing intellectual property assignment agreements. Such a rigid deadline may not be feasible or legally compliant in all jurisdictions, especially considering the variations in governmental authority processing times and requirements. Furthermore, giving the assignor Party the right to withhold consent directly contradicts the purpose of the Separation Agreement, which mandates the transfer of IP rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction; however, generally, laws governing intellectual property assignment do not impose such rigid deadlines and require mutual cooperation for effective transfer.

Section 3.01. License Grants.
(a) Patents. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, as of the Distribution Date, Nuance hereby grants to SpinCo and the
members of the SpinCo Group a worldwide, non-exclusive, fully paid-up, perpetual and irrevocable, transferable (subject to ARTICLE VIII), sublicensable
(subject to Section 3.01(g)) license under the Nuance Patents, solely to the extent that claims of the Nuance Patents cover products or services of the
SpinCo Business in the SpinCo Field of Use, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof, in each case to make, have made, use, sell, offer for
sale, import and otherwise exploit such products and services, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 3.01. License Grants.
(a) Patents. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, as of the Distribution Date, Nuance hereby grants to SpinCo and the
members of the SpinCo Group a worldwide, non-exclusive, fully paid-up license under the Nuance Patents, solely to the extent that claims of the Nuance Patents cover products or services of the
SpinCo Business in the SpinCo Field of Use, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof, in each case to make, have made, use, sell, offer for
sale, import and otherwise exploit such products and services, together with natural extensions and evolutions thereof. This license shall automatically expire after 1 year from the distribution date.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the terms "perpetual and irrevocable", and adding a condition for the license to automatically expire after one year introduces a contradiction with typical IP licensing practices, where perpetual licenses are common for significant IP transfers in corporate separations. The initial agreement aimed for long-term stability in IP usage, while the modification imposes an unreasonable restriction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles concerning reasonable expectations and good faith in long-term agreements.

Section 11.03. Governing Law; Jurisdiction. Any disputes relating to, arising out of or resulting from this Agreement, including to its execution,
performance, or enforcement, shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of Delaware, regardless of the Laws that
might otherwise govern under applicable principles of conflicts of Laws thereof. Each Party irrevocably consents to the exclusive jurisdiction, forum and
venue of the Delaware Court of Chancery (and if the Delaware Court of Chancery shall be unavailable, any Delaware State court or the federal court
sitting in the State of Delaware) over any and all claims, disputes, controversies or disagreements between the Parties or any of their respective Affiliates,
successors and assigns under or related to this Agreement or any of the transactions contemplated hereby, including their execution, performance or
enforcement, whether in contract, tort or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 11.03. Governing Law; Jurisdiction. Any disputes relating to, arising out of or resulting from this Agreement, including to its execution, performance, or enforcement, shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the Laws of the State of Delaware, regardless of the Laws that might otherwise govern under applicable principles of conflicts of Laws thereof. Each Party consents to the non-exclusive jurisdiction, forum and venue of a court to be decided by the defendant company (Nuance or Cerence) from which the suit is filed.
perturbation.explanation: Switching from exclusive to non-exclusive jurisdiction introduces uncertainty and could contradict legal principles requiring clear jurisdictional clauses. Giving the defendant the choice of venue introduces bias and could contradict principles of fairness and impartiality.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of contract law requiring clear and unambiguous terms, and principles of civil procedure regarding fair and impartial venue selection.
